Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 06:33PM Chloe2 wrote: Thank you 1openheart for the reply. I am trying to research all I can, and talk to as many people as I can so I can make educated decisions. My brca comes back on the 23rd. I am having a really tough time emotionally, and have developed fluid and bloodclots after the lumpectomy so I am really uncomfortable as well. If my brca comes back positive and I decide to go with BMX I just don't know if I can go thru with reconstruction. The thought of TE's literally sickens me. The one step seemed more appealing. The plastic surgeon I met with does not do the procedure I would have to look around. I think I would be a candidate. I am 47, a C-D cup, no sagging, radiation would not be necessary if I opt for BMX. However I think I have very tight muscles. I remember when I had my c-section (15 years ago) the drs said my muscles were so hard and tight they usually only see that in professional dancers. I don't know if I can handle months of pain, discomfort, appointments.....

I have recently had a lumpectomy for DCIS. My rec was for radiation, tamoxifen. and oorphectmy (SP) unless brca positive then they are rec bilateral mastectomy. Have been trying to gather information. TE's seem horrendous to me, one step reconstruction is more appealing to me but does not seem to be the norm. Any info would be appreciated. Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 07:09PM Chloe2 wrote: Hi again 1openheart, may I ask why you opted for mastectomy if your BRCA was negative? The rec from my Dr's is that if I am BRCA negative to have radiation, ovaries out, and tamoxifen, However they feel that if BRCA positive I should have a PBMX. Even though they say that if BRCA positive doing all the above mentioned risk reducers I can get my risk to 12-15% which seems quite good to me. Am I crazy? Also I am usually a very decisive person and with this situation if positive I just don't know what the right answer is. 12-15 doesn't seem so bad, but I realize if it were to come back it could be invasive next time....

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2017 04:48PM Chloe2 wrote: I'm wondering if anyone else is having issues with pain right under the bottom of the rib cage on the left side. I've been having a lot of pain there. I discussed it with my RO yesterday (I'm going to follow up with my primary care doctor just to be sure there is anything else going on) but the RO said that the top of the colon on the left side receives some radiation that can cause inflammation and pain. Has anyone else experienced this issue? And if so any tips on how to feel better? I had a similar pain prior to a shingles outbreak and thought maybe I was having another outbreak (I have immune issues and have had repeated bouts of shingles) but I really believe this is intestinal related. Any insight would be appreciated.

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2019 08:41PM Chloe2 wrote: I haven't posted in quite some time, and here I am again...I had DCIS right breast in 2013. I had a lumpectomy followed by radiation. I then had a new primary DCIS left breast 2017 again having a lumpectomy and radiation.I had a mammogram with 3D and mag views. There is a grouping of calcium microcalcifications that are more conspicuous than previously seen and suspicious and will be having a biopsy Monday morning. I'm not even sure how I feel I think I am just numb. I spoke directly with the tech as I know her quite well and I could tell by her voice that these are pointing to malignancy. I have been down this road twice so I know the questions to ask. I know nothing is set in stone until the pathology report comes back but I do believe I am looking at a Mastectomy. I had radiation and I have other health issues that would make reconstruction questionable. I think my biggest concern all along all these years has been if it comes back will it be invasive this time. I'm not even sure why I am writing this I guess I am looking for others to reach out who may have had a similar experience.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy Lynn721 Chloe2
